intro: Aulacospermum dichotomum, commonly known as the dichotomous aulacospermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
